title: Puerto Rico Kicks Off Bankruptcy-Exit Trial on Public Debt Restructuring
sub_head: The oversight board steering Puerto Rico’s bankruptcy says a proposed restructuring could combat economic decline
body:
Puerto Rico kicked off a trial on its bankruptcy-exit plan as the oversight board steering the restructuring efforts argued that most creditors “enthusiastically” support a proposed write-down of the territory’s public debts.
Martin Bienenstock, the lawyer for the oversight board, touted the merits of Puerto Rico’s plan of adjustment at a court hearing Monday, beginning a trial that is expected to last several weeks.
